acidosis_management.title: Acidosis Management Protocol
acidosis_management.content: Blood gas threshold for acidosis management: pH < 7.35 indicates acidosis. For metabolic acidosis, target pH > 7.20. For respiratory acidosis, focus on improving ventilation. Bicarbonate therapy considered when pH < 7.15 or HCO3- < 10 mEq/L. Monitor serum electrolytes, especially potassium and chloride. Consider underlying cause: diabetic ketoacidosis, lactic acidosis, or renal failure.

ards_ventilator_settings.title: ARDS Ventilator Management
ards_ventilator_settings.content: Standard ventilator settings for ARDS: Tidal volume 6 mL/kg predicted body weight (PBW), PEEP 8-15 cmH2O, FiO2 to maintain SpO2 88-95%, Plateau pressure < 30 cmH2O. Use ARDSNet protocol: Low tidal volume strategy, permissive hypercapnia acceptable (pH > 7.20), prone positioning for severe ARDS (PaO2/FiO2 < 150). Monitor driving pressure (Pplat - PEEP) < 15 cmH2O.

sepsis_diagnosis.title: Sepsis-3 Diagnostic Criteria
sepsis_diagnosis.content: Sepsis-3 definition: Life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by dysregulated host response to infection. SOFA score ≥ 2 points indicates organ dysfunction. qSOFA criteria: altered mental status (GCS < 15), systolic BP ≤ 100 mmHg, respiratory rate ≥ 22/min. Two or more qSOFA criteria suggest high risk. Septic shock: vasopressor requirement to maintain MAP ≥ 65 mmHg and lactate > 2 mmol/L despite adequate fluid resuscitation.

acute_respiratory_failure.title: Acute Respiratory Failure Management
acute_respiratory_failure.content: Acute respiratory failure management: Type I (hypoxemic): PaO2 < 60 mmHg on room air, treat with oxygen therapy, consider NIV or intubation. Type II (hypercapnic): PaCO2 > 50 mmHg with pH < 7.35, consider NIV first, intubation if NIV fails. Monitor ABG every 2-4 hours initially. Target SpO2 88-95% to avoid oxygen toxicity. Consider underlying causes: pneumonia, COPD exacerbation, pulmonary edema, ARDS.

hemodynamic_monitoring.title: Hemodynamic Monitoring in ICU
hemodynamic_monitoring.content: Hemodynamic monitoring parameters: MAP target 65-70 mmHg, CVP 8-12 mmHg, cardiac index > 2.5 L/min/m², SVR 800-1200 dyn·s/cm⁵. Use fluid responsiveness tests: passive leg raise, pulse pressure variation > 13%, stroke volume variation > 10%. Vasopressor choice: norepinephrine first-line, add vasopressin if refractory. Inotrope consideration: dobutamine for low cardiac output, milrinone for right heart failure.

sedation_analgesia.title: ICU Sedation and Analgesia Protocol
sedation_analgesia.content: ICU sedation protocol: RASS target -2 to 0 (light sedation), use RASS and CAM-ICU for delirium assessment. First-line: propofol or dexmedetomidine. Avoid benzodiazepines when possible. Analgesia: fentanyl or morphine for pain, consider regional anesthesia. Daily sedation interruption and spontaneous breathing trials. Monitor for withdrawal symptoms. Delirium prevention: early mobility, sleep hygiene, family presence.

nutrition_support.title: ICU Nutrition Support Guidelines
nutrition_support.content: ICU nutrition support: Start enteral nutrition within 24-48 hours if no contraindications. Target 25-30 kcal/kg/day, protein 1.2-2.0 g/kg/day. Use indirect calorimetry when available. Trophic feeding (10-20 kcal/hour) acceptable for first week. Monitor gastric residuals < 500 mL. Consider post-pyloric feeding for high aspiration risk. Parenteral nutrition if enteral not feasible after 7 days. Monitor glucose control, target 140-180 mg/dL.

infection_control.title: ICU Infection Control Measures
infection_control.content: ICU infection control: Hand hygiene before and after patient contact. Central line bundle: chlorhexidine skin prep, full barrier precautions, avoid femoral site, daily necessity review. VAP prevention: head of bed elevation 30-45°, daily sedation interruption, oral care with chlorhexidine. CAUTI prevention: aseptic insertion, maintain closed system, daily necessity review. Contact precautions for MDROs. Environmental cleaning with EPA-registered disinfectants.
